intro: Thalictrum aquilegiifolium var. daisenense, commonly known as the Daisen meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
